alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 17 at 9:33PM EDT until July 17 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL MONROE AND SOUTHEASTERN OWEN COUNTIES... At 933 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Spencer, or 14 miles west of Bloomington, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Ellettsville around 950 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Bloomington, Whitehall and Indiana University. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
